member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PngEncoder.CRC32
member.summary: Computes the CRC32 value for a given data set.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PngEncoder.CRC32.MakeCRCTable
member.summary: Populates the CRC32 checksum values for every byte. This should only be called if you are using this library on a non-standard platform that uses some kind of weird binary encoding of bytes.

member.summary: Returns the current running CRC32 result for a PNG file.
member.returns: An unsigned 32bit integer representing the current CRC32.

member.summary: Returns the current running CRC32 result for a PNG file.
member.returns: An unsigned 32bit integer representing the CRC32.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PngEncoder.PngChunkTypes.Header
member.summary: The first chunk in a png file. Can only exists once. Contains common information like the width and the height of the image or the used compression method.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PngEncoder.PngChunkTypes.Palette
member.summary: The PLTE chunk contains from 1 to 256 palette entries, each a three byte series in the RGB format.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PngEncoder.PngChunkTypes.Data
member.summary: The IDAT chunk contains the actual image data. The image can contains more than one chunk of this type. All chunks together are the whole image.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PngEncoder.PngChunkTypes.End
member.summary: This chunk must appear last. It marks the end of the PNG datastream. The chunk's data field is empty.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PngEncoder.PngChunkTypes.PaletteAlpha
member.summary: This chunk specifies that the image uses simple transparency: either alpha values associated with palette entries (for indexed-color images) or a single transparent color (for grayscale and truecolor images).

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PngEncoder.PngChunkTypes.Text
member.summary: Textual information that the encoder wishes to record with the image can be stored in tEXt chunks. Each tEXt chunk contains a keyword and a text string.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PngEncoder.PngChunkTypes.Gamma
member.summary: This chunk specifies the relationship between the image samples and the desired display output intensity.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PngEncoder.PngChunkTypes.Physical
member.summary: The pHYs chunk specifies the intended pixel size or aspect ratio for display of the image.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PngEncoder.PngHeader.Width
member.summary: The dimension in x-direction of the image in pixels.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PngEncoder.PngHeader.Height
member.summary: The dimension in y-direction of the image in pixels.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PngEncoder.PngHeader.BitDepth
member.summary: Bit depth is a single-byte integer giving the number of bits per sample or per palette index (not per pixel). Valid values are 1, 2, 4, 8, and 16, although not all values are allowed for all color types.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PngEncoder.PngHeader.ColorType
member.summary: Color type is a integer that describes the interpretation of the image data. Color type codes represent sums of the following values: 1 (palette used), 2 (color used), and 4 (alpha channel used).

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PngEncoder.PngHeader.CompressionMethod
member.summary: Indicates the method used to compress the image data. At present, only compression method 0 (deflate/inflate compression with a sliding window of at most 32768 bytes) is defined.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PngEncoder.PngHeader.FilterMethod
member.summary: Indicates the preprocessing method applied to the image data before compression. At present, only filter method 0 (adaptive filtering with five basic filter types) is defined.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PngEncoder.PngHeader.InterlaceMethod
member.summary: Indicates the transmission order of the image data. Two values are currently defined: 0 (no interlace) or 1 (Adam7 interlace).

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PngEncoder.PNGWriter
member.summary: WriteableBitmap Extensions for PNG Writing.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PngEncoder.PNGWriter.DetectWBByteOrder
member.summary: Detects the color order of a stored byte array. Byte order may change between platforms, you should call this once before writting a PNG or if you have any issues with colors changing.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PngEncoder.PNGWriter.WritePNG(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Write and PNG file out to a file stream. Currently compression is not supported.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PngEncoder.PNGWriter.WritePNG(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.IO.Stream,System.Int32)
member.summary: Write and PNG file out to a file stream. Currently compression is not supported.
member.param: Level of compression to use (-1=auto, 0=none, 1-100 is percentage).

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ISupportTransparency
member.summary: An interface that defines common properties and methods for tile data that supports transparency.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ISupportTransparency.IsTransparencySupported
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this tile will support transparent elements.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ITileData
member.summary: An interface that defines common properties and methods for the different types of tile data.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ITileData.CreateTileData(System.Uri)
member.summary: Prepares shell tile data from Telerik's tile data.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ITileData.RegisterTile(System.Uri)
member.summary: Saves information about the actual location of the images used by LiveTileHelper.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ITileData.MeasureMode
member.summary: Provides options for the display of UIElement in tiles. If the mode is Tile, the tile will be created with its default size and the provided element will be placed in the dimensions provided by the tile itself. If the mode is Element, the element will be taken with its own size and stretched/schrinked to fit the tile.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.MeasureMode
member.summary: Defines the possible modes for measuring the elements passed to .

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.MeasureMode.Tile
member.summary: In this mode when creates tiles it takes their size as a base and places the passed element relatively to the tile.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.MeasureMode.Element
member.summary: In this mode when creates tiles it takes the size of the UIElement and stretches it to fit the tile if necessary.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadCycleTileData
member.summary: Represents a class used for generating cycle tiles from visual elements.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadCycleTileData.SmallVisualElement
member.summary: Gets or sets the visual element which will be used as a small background image.
member.remarks: Setting this will override the SmallBackgroundImage property.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadCycleTileData.CycleVisualElements
member.summary: Gets or sets the visual elements which will be used as cycle images.
member.remarks: Setting this will override the CycleImages property.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadCycleTileData.IsTransparencySupported
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this tile will support transparent elements.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadCycleTileData.MeasureMode
member.summary: Provides options for the display of UIElement in tiles. If the mode is Tile, the tile will be created with its default size and the provided element will be placed in the dimensions provided by the tile itself. If the mode is Element, the element will be taken with its own size and stretched/schrinked to fit the tile.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadExtendedTileData
member.summary: Represents the class used for generating the live tiles.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadExtendedTileData.VisualElement
member.summary: Gets or sets the visual element which will be used as a background of the front tile.
member.remarks: Setting this will override the BackgroundImage property.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadExtendedTileData.BackVisualElement
member.summary: Gets or sets the visual element which will be used as a background of the back tile.
member.remarks: Setting this will override the BackBackgroundImage property.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadExtendedTileData.IsTransparencySupported
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this tile will support transparent elements.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadExtendedTileData.MeasureMode
member.summary: Provides options for the display of UIElement in tiles. If the mode is Tile, the tile will be created with its default size and the provided element will be placed in the dimensions provided by the tile itself. If the mode is Element, the element will be taken with its own size and stretched/schrinked to fit the tile.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadFlipTileData
member.summary: Represents a class used for generating flip tiles from visual elements.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadFlipTileData.VisualElement
member.summary: Gets or sets the visual element which will be used as a background of the front side of the tile.
member.remarks: Setting this will override the BackgroundImage property.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadFlipTileData.BackVisualElement
member.summary: Gets or sets the visual element which will be used as a background of the back side of the tile.
member.remarks: Setting this will override the BackBackgroundImage property.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadFlipTileData.SmallVisualElement
member.summary: Gets or sets the visual element which will be used as a background for the small size tile.
member.remarks: Setting this will override the SmallBackgroundImage property.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadFlipTileData.WideVisualElement
member.summary: Gets or sets the visual element which will be used as a background for the front side of the wide size tile.
member.remarks: Setting this will override the WideBackgroundImage property.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadFlipTileData.WideBackVisualElement
member.summary: Gets or sets the visual element which will be used as a background for the back side of the wide size tile.
member.remarks: Setting this will override the WideBackBackgroundImage property.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadFlipTileData.IsTransparencySupported
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this tile will support transparent elements.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadFlipTileData.MeasureMode
member.summary: Provides options for the display of UIElement in tiles. If the mode is Tile, the tile will be created with its default size and the provided element will be placed in the dimensions provided by the tile itself. If the mode is Element, the element will be taken with its own size and stretched/schrinked to fit the tile.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadIconicTileData
member.summary: Represents a class used for generating iconic tiles from visual elements.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadIconicTileData.IconVisualElement
member.summary: Gets or sets the visual element which will be used as an icon image of the tile.
member.remarks: Setting this will override the IconImage property.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadIconicTileData.SmallIconVisualElement
member.summary: Gets or sets the visual element which will be used as a small icon image of the tile.
member.remarks: Setting this will override the SmallIconImage property.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadIconicTileData.MeasureMode
member.summary: Provides options for the display of UIElement in tiles. If the mode is Tile, the tile will be created with its default size and the provided element will be placed in the dimensions provided by the tile itself. If the mode is Element, the element will be taken with its own size and stretched/schrinked to fit the tile.
